title: STRIPE-seq library construction

source.description: Check RNA quality and concentration on an Agilent TapeStation using an RNA ScreenTape.

source.body: You should have at least 50 to 200 ng of total RNA at a concentration of at least 30 to 125 ng/μl. Your total RNA should also not be highly degraded, as measured by the quality of the rRNA peaks.

source.title: Terminator Exonuclease (TEX) Digestion of Uncapped RNA

source.description: Prepare TEX Reaction. TEX preferentially degrades uncapped RNA, thus reducing the amount of rRNA and degraded mRNA fragments in the sample.

source.description: Anneal reverse transcription oligo (RTO) to RNA. STRIPE-seq primes RT using a random pentamer with the full length TrueSeq R2 adapter (including the barcode) attached to it.

Run final libraries on the Agilent TapeStation using a High Sensitivity D5000 ScreenTape.

source.body: Final libraries should be dsitributed between 250 to 750 bp with a total library amount of 25 to 100 ng.

description: Accurate mapping of transcription start sites (TSSs) is key for understanding transcriptional regulation; however, current protocols for genome-wide TSS profiling are laborious and expensive. We present Survey of TRanscription Initiation at Promoter Elements with high-throughput sequencing (STRIPE-seq), a simple, rapid, and cost-effective protocol for sequencing capped RNA 5’ ends from as little as 50 ng total RNA. Including depletion of uncapped RNA and bead cleanups, a STRIPE-seq library can be constructed in approximately 4 hours.
